bill_title: honoring Donna and Floyd Cammack on the occasion of their seventieth wedding anniversary.

bill_versions.bill_text: A LEGISLATIVE COMMEMORATION, honoring Donna and Floyd Cammack on the occasion of their seventieth wedding anniversary. WHEREAS, the year was 1952--Elizabeth became the Queen of England, the Yankees defeated the Brooklyn Dodgers, Singing in the Rain was playing on the big screen, the cost of a first-class stamp was three cents, and a beautiful young woman named Donna married a dashing young man named Floyd; and WHEREAS, while that special day in Miles City, Montana, was the culmination of a romantic flirtation that began between two elementary school students, it was also the start of a seven-decade adventure; and WHEREAS, from the time of the wedding blessing, Donna and Floyd weathered their share of trials and tribulations, but always remembered to place the highest priority on the love they shared and the values and respect that brought them together; and WHEREAS, five children, fourteen grandchildren, and thirty-two great grandchildren later, Donna and Floyd have much to remember, much to celebrate, and much to look forward to in the coming years: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT COMMEMORATED, by the Ninety-Seventh Legislature of the State of South Dakota, that on February 15, 2022, Donna and Floyd Cammack will have shared in their incredible journey, side-by-side and hand-in-hand, for seventy years and in honor of that, the Legislature extends its sincerest wish that happiness will continue to envelope their union and that their days together will be good and long upon this earth.
